title: ENT - SSIS - Refactor SPPassValidate functions to C# managed code
acceptanceCriteria: SSIS and API should continue to work, all feature that has change password capabilities smoketest directinterface.asmx, it should not go back the SPPass.dll issue and uservalidation should be succeeded.
description: SPPass.dll late binding errors seem to occur often, and could be attributed to SSIS crashing Refactor the functions in SPPass/SPPassValidate DLLs so there is no late binding Notes: Aljon Implement the new SPPassValidate.dll retire SPPass.dll in ENT Project, remove all reference No unmanaged dll's for SPPass and/or SPPassValidate
devNotes: Roland rebuild the SPPassValidate to add a SPPassWrapper.Encryptpassword. Implement the new SPPassValidate.dll retired SPPass.dll in ENT Project, remove all reference smoke testing: organization add/edit - good User add/edit - good User change password - good Device page update - good product add/edit - good Inbound upload - good Outbound reports - good manual upload - good

title: ENT: Scheduler is Not Working
devNotes: Update the source code to remove the version of GotDotNet.ApplicationBlocks.Data in app config
qaNotes: Error in the scheduler log: WRN: Assembly binding logging is turned OFF. To enable assembly bind failure logging, set the registry value [HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Fusion!EnableLog] (DWORD) to 1. Note: There is some performance penalty associated with assembly bind failure logging. title: ENT: Standardize SSIS ENT Master Build to x86
acceptanceCriteria: Validate that ENT Master performs all intended functions reliably and completely under standard operational conditions.
description: Purpose: We want to reduce platform-related runtime issues and improve consistency by building as many SSIS ENT Master solution components as possible in x86 (instead of Mixed Platforms / Any CPU ), ensuring DLL outputs align with an x86 runtime environment. Risk & Impact: If fixed: Builds become more consistent and aligned with x86 runtime expectations; reduces DLL architecture mismatch issues. If unfixed: Continued risk of architecture-related runtime failures (BadImageFormat/missing load issues) and inconsistent deployment behavior. Scope of Work: Create/adjust build configuration so the solution builds using x86 . Replace Any CPU / Mixed Platforms with x86 where feasible across all projects in the solution. Ensure resulting DLL outputs are x86 (or otherwise explicitly confirmed compatible with x86 runtime). Perform a test build and document outcomes. Additional Notes: Devnotes: ### Change Summary ### What Changed: What Was Impacted: What Must Be Tested: ### Peer Review ### Buddy Tested by: Buddy Test Date: Buddy Test Status:
devNotes: -update solutions and projects by adding x86 profile - Updated Soltions: MasterSolution.sln SupplyInstaller.sln DashboardMasterSolution.sln Projects - Fix issues on Newtonsoft.Json - Fix issue on reclycling reference How to Test: Validate that ENT Master performs all intended functions reliably and completely under standard operational conditions.

title: EIA: Analytics > Dashboard > Text labels inside widget submenus are missing
acceptanceCriteria: The fields on those submenus should have text labels.
description: Labels inside widget submenus are missing. Manage Report Share Widget Manage Parameters
devNotes: DevNotes: 2025-12-20 - Alcel Cause: SSIS and dashboard integration use mismatched cultures; CurrentUICulture is empty, causing missing text labels. Solution: Update the dashboard project to use Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture for localization.

title: NextGen API: Unable to Login after changing User's Area and performing Initialize DB
acceptanceCriteria: Add handling for the scenario where a user’s area is changed in SSIS while the user is already logged in to NextGen. If the user runs InitializeDB after their area has been changed, the NextGen app should display an error.
description: Issue: After changing the User’s Area and performing Initialize DB , users are unable to log in to the device. Additionally, it is observed that the generated database is missing a majority of its expected data. This issue persists even when attempting to log in using a user with All Area access , which should normally allow login regardless of the device area. (please see attached video has been attached for reference.) from NextGen 80.1.5.23 Additional Info: Devnotes: ### Change Summary ### What Changed: What Was Impacted: What Must Be Tested: ### Peer Review ### Buddy Tested by: Buddy Test Date: Buddy Test Status:
devNotes: Barney - 12/16/2025 - Unable to generate and download users when area is not matched to device area. - Can be able to generate and download if user is 'All Area' access
qaNotes: When the user has CabComm permission and the User Area matches the Device Area , the user can successfully perform Initialize DB and Force Sync . However, if the User Area is changed so that it no longer matches the Device Area , and Initialize DB is triggered, the user will no longer be able to perform Initialize DB or Force Sync . The app will now prompt " The user's area does not match the device area. Please contact your system administrator " After clicking OK , the user is forced to log out . Despite this, verification shows that the user is still able to log in again even when the User Area differs from the Device Area .

title: ENT: Interfaces > Scheduled Packages/Tasks - The UI is at loading state for a while when Check/Uncheck 'Deliver via Email' checkbox and generate an error log - Edit a existing Standard report - QA and PROD
description: The UI is at loading state for a while when Check/Uncheck 'Deliver via Email' checkbox and generate an error log - Edit a existing Standard report - QA and PROD
devNotes: fix ui issue on loading records
qaNotes: When editing an existing scheduled report with both Delivery Options -> Deliver via Email and Deliver via FTP (FTP Protocol) were selected, after unchecking/checking Deliver via Email, the page refreshes and displays the email fields correctly now.
